oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Enhancing agroecological innovations with a multi-level approach to experimental research needs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: LE PICHON, V.
Filleron, Emmanuelle
Ricavy, I.
Taussig, C.
Bellon, Stéphane
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Research methodology and philosophy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Public policies clearly aim at an ecologisation of agriculture. However, few concrete goals or incentives have been established to mobilize the experimental research. Applied to 13-year results of four experimental stations of the South-East of France, the Direct-Indirect-System multi-level analysis grid showed a diversification of their experimental strategies. These three levels of analysis, combined with the identification of different types of agroecosystems, appears as promising for instigating assessment and determining agroecological innovation priorities for an experimental station, a territory or a food chain.
